page.title: 02Emborough Pond or Pool
page.content: Emborough Pond is situated off the main Bath to Wells road. It is a quiet, picturesque, picnic and fishing spot, set in a valley with beech woods on either side and marsh land at the rear. There has recently been a number of platforms build around the edge of the pond, used for coarse fishing.Day permits are issued from the local bailiff or from a pet shop in Wells. The pond attracts a variety of wildfowl including ducks, moorhens and coots. It has been known or swans to nest there. It also has a stone-built boat house with housing for one small craft. A local school uses the pond for canoeing. In the winter of 1985 the pond for froze over and people were seen iceskating and walking on it.
